segment.source: Automate reboots before you run an assessment
segment.target: Automate reboots before you run an assessment

segment.source: Automate reboots before you run an assessment
segment.target: Automate reboots before you run an assessment

segment.source: Automate reboots before you run an assessment
segment.target: Automate reboots before you run an assessment

segment.source: Some assessments require the computer to reboot while the assessment is running.
segment.target: Some assessments require the computer to reboot while the assessment is running.

segment.source: If you plan to manually monitor a computer while the assessment is running, you can log on every time that the computer reboots.
segment.target: If you plan to manually monitor a computer while the assessment is running, you can log on every time that the computer reboots.

segment.source: But if you don't plan to monitor the computer while the assessment is running, you can configure the computer to automatically log on.
segment.target: But if you don't plan to monitor the computer while the assessment is running, you can configure the computer to automatically log on.

segment.source: The procedures in this topic explain:
segment.target: The procedures in this topic explain:

segment.source: How to configure a computer to log on without prompts by adjusting settings in the registry.
segment.target: How to configure a computer to log on without prompts by adjusting settings in the registry.

segment.source: We recommend this procedure when you use the Windows Assessment Console to assess a local computer.
segment.target: We recommend this procedure when you use the Windows Assessment Console to assess a local computer.

segment.source: How to create a user account that will automatically log on to a computer after a reboot.
segment.target: How to create a user account that will automatically log on to a computer after a reboot.

segment.source: We recommend this procedure for test computers that don't have domain access or other potential network vulnerabilities.
segment.target: We recommend this procedure for test computers that don't have domain access or other potential network vulnerabilities.

segment.source: To adjust registry settings for automatic logon
segment.target: To adjust registry settings for automatic logon

segment.source: Click Start, type Regedit, and then click Registry Editor.
segment.target: Click Start, type Regedit, and then click Registry Editor.

segment.source: Locate this registry key in Registry Editor:
segment.target: Locate this registry key in Registry Editor:

segment.source: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindows NTCurrentVersionWinlogon
segment.target: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftWindows NTCurrentVersionWinlogon

segment.source: Double-click the DefaultUserName entry, type your user name, and then click OK.
segment.target: Double-click the DefaultUserName entry, type your user name, and then click OK.

segment.source: Double-click the DefaultPassword entry, type your password, and then click OK.
segment.target: Double-click the DefaultPassword entry, type your password, and then click OK.

segment.source: Security Note:
segment.target: Security Note:

segment.source: This password is stored in plain text and presents a security vulnerability.
segment.target: This password is stored in plain text and presents a security vulnerability.

segment.source: We recommend that you use a test account and remove the key value when you're finished running assessments.
segment.target: We recommend that you use a test account and remove the key value when you're finished running assessments.

segment.source: If the DefaultPassword value doesn't exist, follow these steps:
segment.target: If the DefaultPassword value doesn't exist, follow these steps:

segment.source: Click Edit, click New, and then click String Value.
segment.target: Click Edit, click New, and then click String Value.

segment.source: In the Value Name box, type DefaultPassword.
segment.target: In the Value Name box, type DefaultPassword.

segment.source: In the Data Type box, confirm that REGSZ is selected.
segment.target: In the Data Type box, confirm that REGSZ is selected.

segment.source: In the Value data box, type your password.
segment.target: In the Value data box, type your password.

segment.source: Click OK to save your changes.
segment.target: Click OK to save your changes.

segment.source: Change the value of the AutoAdminLogon key from 0 (FALSE) to 1 (TRUE).
segment.target: Change the value of the AutoAdminLogon key from 0 (FALSE) to 1 (TRUE).

segment.source: This enables the AutoAdminLogon feature.
segment.target: This enables the AutoAdminLogon feature.

segment.source: Exit Registry Editor.
segment.target: Exit Registry Editor.

segment.source: Reboot the computer and make sure that it logs you on automatically.
segment.target: Reboot the computer and make sure that it logs you on automatically.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To bypass the AutoAdminLogon process, and to log on as a different user, hold down the Shift key after you log off or after Windows restarts.
segment.target: To bypass the AutoAdminLogon process, and to log on as a different user, hold down the Shift key after you log off or after Windows restarts.

segment.source: When you finish running assessments on the computer, you can change the registry settings back to the original values to follow the regular logon process.
segment.target: When you finish running assessments on the computer, you can change the registry settings back to the original values to follow the regular logon process.

segment.source: To prepare a user account and disable secure logon
segment.target: To prepare a user account and disable secure logon

segment.source: Create a single standard user for the computer.
segment.target: Create a single standard user for the computer.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Don't give the user a password.
segment.target: Don't give the user a password.

segment.source: Don't allow or configure a connection to a domain.
segment.target: Don't allow or configure a connection to a domain.

segment.source: Delete all other users, passwords, and domain connections.
segment.target: Delete all other users, passwords, and domain connections.

segment.source: Disable secure logon by following these steps:
segment.target: Disable secure logon by following these steps:

segment.source: Click Start, and then type netplwiz to find and open the User Accounts dialog box.
segment.target: Click Start, and then type netplwiz to find and open the User Accounts dialog box.

segment.source: On the Advanced tab, clear the Require users to press Ctrl+Alt+Delete check box.
segment.target: On the Advanced tab, clear the Require users to press Ctrl+Alt+Delete check box.

segment.source: This single user account allows the assessment to run on the computer without any monitoring or manual logon steps.
segment.target: This single user account allows the assessment to run on the computer without any monitoring or manual logon steps.

segment.target: Related topics
